intro: Onosma yajiangensis, commonly known as the Yajiang onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, adapted to the cold and high-altitude environment. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Onosma yajiangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
